result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard A Corn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Joint and Several with Cheryl Miller: 15CF265, Awaehsaeh Olson : 16CF32,  and Dustin Waupoose:  16CF33

DNA Sample.  
Eligible for CIP 1-1-19 and SAP 7-22-18.  
Full-time work or 5 job searches per week.  
AODA and follow through.  Absolute sobriety, and no class B licensed establishments unless agent allows for work.  
Criminal Thinking and follow through.  Counseling if agent feels valuable.  No contact with the victim Jeff Lutzow and stay at least 100 yds from Park Ave, Mattoon.  Apology letter within 30 days through the agent.  
Fines and costs to run concurrently with sentence.

Parties request a pre-sentence report.  Court orders the report.
